newsitem.title: HUNGARY: NEW BOMBING HITS BUDAPEST AS POLICE SOLVES OLD ONE.
newsitem.headline: NEW BOMBING HITS BUDAPEST AS POLICE SOLVES OLD ONE.

text.p: A hand grenade explosion that damaged six or seven cars of a Budapest car dealer on Wednesday night could be linked to a spate of bombings and armed attacks since September, police said.

"We do not yet know when exactly the explosion happened as neither the car dealership's security guard, nor the neighbours heard the explosion," Colonel Janos Lazar of Budapest police told a news conference.
He added that the type of the grenade and the targeted business could mean last night's explosion is linked to the previous cases.
Budapest has been hit by more than a dozen bombings and five armed attacks since September, in which one man was killed, two severly injured. The bombings caused extensive material damage.
Lazar said the police recently solved one earlier case but has not yet achieved a breakthrough.
"This would be a breakthrough if it could lead to other cases being solved," he said.
